topic.title: OGame
topic.body:
How difficult do you think it is to implement a relatively simple browser game on this network?

[De](/1E4XLtKC59YV8V9JQ4AkeqSvqECSvrUtnv/?Topic:1_1KBkXs64bRMnZoTXzq5gdrsd1ZupSfMrwE/OGame) [Pt](/1LULE6frq3kw2vbhe4i6ArUTo4YT99Czbj/?Topic:1_1KBkXs64bRMnZoTXzq5gdrsd1ZupSfMrwE/OGame)  [It](/1MxvDmGn5fipn7cyjXAMyMZPH3SyhwfZkw/?Topic:1_1KBkXs64bRMnZoTXzq5gdrsd1ZupSfMrwE/OGame) [Pl](/1GRYnz73jSXoMMZNU3nSmbCFA3twuitcoo/?Topic:1604967905_1KBkXs64bRMnZoTXzq5gdrsd1ZupSfMrwE/OGame) [Ua](/193psz3yGj7EH39nyKb4A2KKBXEHT49Csf/?Topic:1605002819_1KBkXs64bRMnZoTXzq5gdrsd1ZupSfMrwE/OGame) [Ru](/1RuZntipLvXcLKFEjT6Fr7ZA3GuywYfr5/?Topic:1605002924_1KBkXs64bRMnZoTXzq5gdrsd1ZupSfMrwE/OGame) [Jp](/http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Am2bDQhptVMxaLtKxbHCorvL1rjXtqdFH/?Topic:1617752636_1KBkXs64bRMnZoTXzq5gdrsd1ZupSfMrwE/OGame) [Ch](http://127.0.0.1:43110/NewGFWTalk.bit/?Topic:1_1KBkXs64bRMnZoTXzq5gdrsd1ZupSfMrwE/OGame)

[gamedevelopment.bit](/gamedevelopment.bit/?Topic:1605621428_1KBkXs64bRMnZoTXzq5gdrsd1ZupSfMrwE/OGame)

1602793600_1KBkXs64bRMnZoTXzq5gdrsd1ZupS.body:
> [smashbuckler](#comment_30_114yCZGnUqTUcasBbAKUS6xmhQyDPC1ZXt): Flappy Bird as an example of another simple game =)

> [mokshanets2](#comment_1_1BTR1SP5uKs6nURymSE4uX74vJ8CmAXyB9): simple game

This is interesting, but can you find games with multiplayer?

> [smashbuckler](#comment_29_114yCZGnUqTUcasBbAKUS6xmhQyDPC1ZXt): Depends on your game mechanics. Should be relatively easy with non-realtime games.

The mechanics of a fairly simple browser-based space strategy OGame.

> [mentos](#comment_6_1DruyFehQkemWTK5XKuFRpXb3tz89FFaVK): If your game is not real time, just make sure you have some good logic on trust system. Maybe blockchain can help you.

To some extent, with the time management games are realtime.

> [mentos](#comment_8_1DruyFehQkemWTK5XKuFRpXb3tz89FFaVK): I've got a bit understanding on the idea. Maybe you can get it to work. Even that you have said it's a real time game, but network communication for Travian-like games like this are not frequent. Blockchain implementation definitely can help you here.

The same server of the "OGame", maybe it really looks like "Travian", this is a PHP script that we want to have here.

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1CiXRY9ATZSoZqBzwMfXEMsKtPRt2aQoF2/data/users/1KBkXs64bRMnZoTXzq5gdrsd1ZupSfMrwE/1603958348-script.zip

> [mentos](#comment_9_1DruyFehQkemWTK5XKuFRpXb3tz89FFaVK): If you want to directly run this code on ZeroNet, unfortunately, ZeroNet still only supports it's own API called ZeroFrame, which is based on JavaScript. Currently, there is no way to implement alternative runtime on ZeroNet remotely, unless you create an extension and invite others to install and use it.

There is no problem that there will be an extension. Let it use the blockchain if necessary. It is crucial that it does not violate the principles of decentralization. This should not require a central server. This should also allow to clone sites.
@gitcenter, this was done temporarily, just to reserve domains for future "universes" of the game.

> [sudoroot64](#comment_7_18RoaAqHB6LgsbrRvZuzWrcd33dZkjAfuG): Without multiplayer, very simple.With Multiplayer, challenging

Of course here means multiplayer, but it is clear to us that this is not so simple.

> [sudoroot64](#comment_14_18RoaAqHB6LgsbrRvZuzWrcd33dZkjAfuG): Some people like to role play on internet forums. That is the simplest form of a multiplayer game. It is sad that there is no java script library for such things.

Is this forum script not suitable for role playing games?

1573616487_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body: It certainly makes sense to use this network for different multiplayer games.

1550907964_19HaBBc1M3usmLxayEasbaTkeZ3Tt.body:
> [aspidochelone](#comment_409_1PPUrYcZ1E1rGkkE6PH18Qi43LRsKABo1Z): Why don't you start a fairly straight D&D type game, a little heavy on collaborative writing?  Simple, easy text format can do LOTS.  It could be fun even when the gnomes get a little technical about exactly how they brew their methamphetamine from wood ashes and sassafras bark.

D&D - a game with a closed end, while as an MMO, we can play indefinitely.

1605013344_15ikhUiQxJkhNQuDUaR1RuUL45p5w.body: [CPanelHosting](https://cpanelhosting.ru/?ref=78096) & [EternalHost](https://eternalhost.net/?from=2096) are the only hosting providers I know with "perpetual" tariffs, in other words, with a one-time payment.
